text.__SUMMARY__: Uropeltis ruhunae is a species of snake in the family Uropeltidae. The species is endemic to Sri Lanka.
text.Etymology: The specific name, ruhunae, refers to the ancient Sri Lankan Kingdom of Ruhuna.
text.Further reading: Deraniyagala, P.E.P. (1954). "Two new snakes from Ceylon". Proceedings of the 10th Congress of the Ceylon Association for the  Advancement of Science 1: 24. (Uropeltis ruhunae, new species).
